schedules

Class DailySchedule

  • java.lang.Object
    • schedules.DailySchedule
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Schedule

    public class DailySchedule
extends java.lang.Object
implements Schedule
    Class to create a daily schedule starting at a given date. Priority will be given to the date, rating, and risk in that order.
    Author:
    Derek Babb

      • Fields inherited from interface schedules.Schedule

    • Method Detail

      • processData

        public void processData(RetailFoodEntry[] data,
                        Date dateIn)
        Method to take all RetailFoodEntries in loaded list and pull out the entries that match the given date. Schedule will continue in sequential dates until max value of inspections are scheduled. The schedule should include dates from this date on.
        Specified by:
        processData in interface Schedule
        Parameters:
        data - All RetailFoodEntry objects in loaded file.
        dateIn - The Date object to begin search.

      • writeSchedule

        public boolean writeSchedule(java.lang.String fileName)
        Method to write the schedule to a CSV file.
        Specified by:
        writeSchedule in interface Schedule
        Parameters:
        fileName - Name of the file to write to.
        Returns:
        if the writing was successful.

      • sortBy

        public void sortBy(java.lang.String value)
        Method to sort the current schedule by various fields. Fields will be "Name", "Date", "Rating" and "Risk".
        Specified by:
        sortBy in interface Schedule
        Parameters:
        value - the field parameter to sort the data by.
